benchmark_details.name: TTPA (Token-level Tool-use Preference Alignment Training Framework)
benchmark_details.overview: TTPA is a training paradigm that constructs token-level tool-use preference datasets to align LLMs with fine-grained preferences using an error-oriented scoring mechanism.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Enhance the tool-use capabilities of large language models (LLMs) by aligning them with fine-grained user preferences.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Fine-grained token-level preference sampling may increase computational complexity and training time.

data.source: Generated using LLMs based on the TTPA framework methods.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with some manual verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance of LLMs in selecting appropriate tools and parameters.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better tool-selection and parameter generation capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: TTPA (Qwen) achieved 86.0% accuracy in the ToolBench benchmark.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments on benchmark datasets demonstrate significant improvements in tool usage.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data privacy measures followed using publicly available datasets.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All tools and datasets used were obtained from existing benchmarks and public resources.
